definition[0]: to do a lot in a limited period of time, or fit a lot of information, ideas etc into a limited space
example[0]: We packed a lot of sightseeing into two weeks.
example[1]: In an essay of 2,000 words, you can pack a lot in.
definition[1]: if a film, play etc packs people in, it attracts large numbers to come and see it
example[2]: Any film starring Tom Cruise always packs them in.
definition[2]: to stop doing a job or activity that you are not enjoying
example[3]: After one year, I packed in university.
example[4]: Sometimes I feel like packing it all in and going off travelling.
definition[3]: used to tell someone to stop doing something that is annoying you
definition[4]: if a machine packs in, it stops working because there is something wrong with it
example[5]: Halfway to the airport, the engine packed in.
